p: Oregano essential oil (EO) quality depends on the thymol and carvacrol content; these isomers are responsible for oregano flavor [ 9, 10] and their different biological properties include antioxidant [ 11], antimicrobial [ 12], acaricidal [ 13], antiparasitic [ 14], and antifungal [ 15] capacities. It is widely known that oregano EO is applied as a natural preservative, extending the shelf life of food products [ 16, 17]. However, the application of oregano EO is limited due to its strong flavor.
